messages.message: Is there a reason we have these restrictions on field names ? It's not hard to imagine that people would like to use exact field names as in doc for extraction.

We use the field name to identify the field in refiner, which means the field name has to be valid in refiner (generally the same conditions as python variable naming, but we can handle spaces by mapping the field name to a “refiner-safe” version)

Ideally users can put more exact text in the field description or reasoning prompt

This doesn't seem that obvious. Do we have some data or feedback on how often people would "want" to provide a text vs being forced to since that's the only option we provide in case they wish to achieve this ?
Aren't field names just a string that we pass ? Not sure if I understand how it relates to python variable naming.
Yes, the current UI is meant to encourage users to use descriptions / reasoning prompts for more complex information.

Just to clarify, in the prompt I had I was looking to provide exact field as it appears in the doc, nothing complex or reasoning like descriptions, which I feel should be common use-case, but seems like we have to use descriptions, which is a bit weird since these are really not description of the field but the field name itself.
